intro: Remember the good old days (like a few years ago) when you can track packages? DAMN I MISS THOSE DAYS, so I decided it was time to take matters into my own hands.
intro_items: Remember the good old days (like a few years ago) when you can track packages?
DAMN I MISS THOSE DAYS, so I decided it was time to take matters into my own hands.

etapes.html:
1. Step 1: Cheap Shipping Means No Tracking (or Really Crappy Tracking)

Étapes :

  1. I ship a lot of large items, using Greyhound freight, The upside is they are 1/3 the cost of other shipping services, and you need to drop off your stuff at a depot.. The downside is slow as a slow bus from Chicago, slow (2+ weeks) with lacking tracking.. (HEY THAT RHYMES!)

2. Step 2: THE SOLUTION:

Étapes :

  1. I paired an Apple AirTag and sent it to the shipper who dropped it into one of the boxes
  2. and IT WORKED!!! (didn't want to post till I was sure) and as a bonus, I was able to find my packages
  3. in a big warehouse / depot instead of the way they where doing it (looking for my waybill # on boxes)
